title: FONT ID Help Please! With image
content:
Busy doing some work for a company who has an existing logo (see sample) which was designed last year and I am trying to identify the font so that we can add accompanying text to the logo.

Have done a search on ‘What the font’ and ‘Identifont’, but have not been able to find a match.

Any assistance would be appreciated, either a close match that you think could have been slightly modified.

Thanks in advance, Adrian

Here’s the image

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090503110302im_/http:/typophile.com/files/olsenslogo_5394.gif)
author: Adrian Monk

comments.content: There is no sample (at least in Chrome and Firefox).
Will repost later, can’t seem to get image up. Apologies for now.
It works now. I don’t recognize it though.

Close to [Foco.](http://web.archive.org/web/20090503110302/http:/www.daltonmaag.com/browse/fonts/dama/foco)

Though the O and e are different. Maybe it’s a custom draw/modification by Dalton Maag?

@ Chris,

[Foco](http://web.archive.org/web/20090503110302/http:/www.daltonmaag.com/browse/fonts/dama/foco) definitely on track with the tapered edges, although not exact. I think that it would have to be custom and the letterforms actually look like [H&FJs’ Gotham](http://web.archive.org/web/20090503110302/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/font_styles.php?productLineID=100008) with the custom terminals. What do you think?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090503110302im_/http:/typophile.com/files/olsens_comparison_5849.gif)
